actions-list.actionItem: The House resumed one minute speeches.
The House received a message from the Senate. The Senate passed S. 1038.
The House proceeded with further one minute speeches.

Mr. Fleischmann asked unanimous consent That, when the House adjourns on Thursday, September 4, 2025, it adjourn to meet on Monday, September 8, 2025, at noon for Morning-Hour debate and 2:00 p.m. for legislative business. Agreed to without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: 214
On motion to recommit Failed by the Yeas and Nays: 209

actions-list.actionItem: The previous question on the motion to recommit was ordered pursuant to clause 2(b) of rule XIX.
Ms. Budzinski moved to recommit to the Committee on Appropriations.
The House adopted the amendments en gros as agreed to by the Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.
The House rose from the Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union to report H.R. 4553.

actions-list.header: On agreeing to the Schweikert amendment; Failed by recorded vote: 76
On agreeing to the Perry amendment; Failed by recorded vote: 127
On agreeing to the Perry amendment; Failed by recorded vote: 120

actions-list.actionItem: At the conclusion of debate on the Schweikert amendment No. 33, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced that the noes had prevailed. Mr. Schweikert demanded a recorded vote and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 672, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Schweikert amendment No. 33.
An amendment, offered by Mr. Schweikert,  numbered 33 printed in House Report 119-232 to revise appropriations to reduce unobligated funds from top-line accounts totaling $37,353,345,385.09.

At the conclusion of debate on the Perry amendment No. 32, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced that the noes had prevailed. Mr. Perry demanded a recorded vote and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 672, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Perry amendment No. 32.
An amendment, offered by Mr. Perry,  numbered 32 printed in House Report 119-232 to strike all funding for the Office of Energy Efficiency and Renewable Energy.

At the conclusion of debate on the Perry amendment No. 31, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced that the ayes had prevailed. Ms. Kaptur demanded a recorded vote and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 672, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Perry amendment No. 31.
An amendment, offered by Mr. Perry,  numbered 31 printed in House Report 119-232 to reduce funding for the Great Lakes Authority and transfer to the SRA.
The House resolved into Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union for further consideration.
Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 4553 â€” "Making appropriations for energy and water development and related agencies for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2026, and for other purposes."
The House proceeded with one minute speeches, which by direction of the Chair would be limited to 5 per side of the aisle.
The Chair designated Mr. Shreve to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by Rev. Neil Stewart, First Presbyterian Church, Columbia, South Carolina.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
